metadata.title: CVE-2021-38208 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
net/nfc/llcp_sock.c in the Linux kernel before 5.12.10 allows localunprivileged users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereferenceand BUG) by making a getsockname call after a certain type of failure of abind call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-lowlatency - 4.4.0-222.255
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-154-generic - 4.15.0-154.161~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-154-generic - 4.15.0-154.161~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-154-lowlatency - 4.15.0-154.161~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1103-kvm - 4.4.0-1103.112
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1138-aws - 4.4.0-1138.152
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1110-aws - 4.15.0-1110.117~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1122-azure - 4.15.0-1122.135~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1107-gcp - 4.15.0-1107.121~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1079-oracle - 4.15.0-1079.87~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-222.255').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-154.161~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1103.112').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1138.152').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1110.117~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1122.135~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1107.121~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1079.87~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
